sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A second reply in defence of the Treatise of baptism (wherein M. Baxters More-proofs are found no proofs) : in two parts, the first defending the antiquityes against his charge of forgery, the second justifying the charge of slander, contradiction and popery against his writings : as also an admonition to M.B., and some reflections by Mr. Tombs upon Mr. B's More proofs : with a rejoynder to Mr Will's his Vindiciae, and an answer to his appeal / by H. Danvers. Danvers, Henry, d. 1687.
[7], 271 p.
Printed for Francis Smith, London : 1675.
"To the reader" signed: Henry Danvers. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library.
=======

Danvers. Danvers, Henry, d. 1687.
[7], 271 p.
Printed for Francis Smith, London : 1675.
"To the reader" signed: Henry Danvers. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library.
